result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin J. Sertle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

14CF30, 15CM2 Cases called @ 1:34 p.m. Defendant Justin J. Sertle in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF30 & 15CM2 - Parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be noted. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing. Statement by DE. Court orders: 14CF30: Ct 1 - 7 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, 142 days CFTS - Restitution in the amount of $34.98 converted to a civil judgment in favor of the victim K.W., costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Ct 2 - 90 days WCJ - concurrent with Ct 1.  
15CM2 - Ct 1 - 7 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Consecutive to 14CF30, costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Ct 4 - 90 days WCJ - concurrent with Ct 1. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 30, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
from Atty Selsing requesting an adjournment - Granted by the Court
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
from Jim Webb, Waushara Co DHS

Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant Justin J. Sertle in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Resolution reached with argued terms on SEH.  State's recommendation stated.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 w/o Repeater Enh:  NC  Plea Ct 4 (POT):  NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.   Ct Nos 2, 3 and 5 all DRI and Repeater Component attached to Ct No 1  Argument by ADA - argues for 2 yrs probation.  Argument by SPD - argues for lesser period of supervision.  Statement by Def: None offered. The Court:  Applauds Def for progress made to date.   S/W - 2 yrs probation:  Conditions:  AODA - formal order, probable already completed; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given   2 days Sentence Credit ordered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Justin J. Sertle in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on February 3, 2015 at 09:50 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:02 p.m. Defendant Justin J. Sertle in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. DA Blader requesting $1500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Patzer.  NGP entered. Court orders $1500 Sig Bond w/ conditions.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 09:50 am.
